message_1: Suppose we have a matrix A= [[1, 2], [3, 4]], and a vector x=[5, 6]. Determine the result of the matrix-vector multiplication Ax in the context of linear logic.
message_2:
To perform the matrix-vector multiplication Ax, we multiply each row of the matrix A by the vector x and sum the results. In this case, we have:

A = [[1, 2],
     [3, 4]]

x = [5,
     6]

Ax = [(1*5 + 2*6),
      (3*5 + 4*6)]

Ax = [(5 + 12),
      (15 + 24)]

Ax = [17,
      39]

So, the result of the matrix-vector multiplication Ax is the vector [17, 39].
